frontmatter.preview_text: The Wagner-Fischer algorithm is a dynamic programming algorithm to determine the (minimum) edit distance between two strings.
frontmatter.title: Wagner-Fischer (Edit Distance)

frontmatter.preview_text: Quicksort is a fast divide-and-conquer algorithm for sorting tasks. It works recursively and in-place.
frontmatter.title: Quicksort

frontmatter.preview_text: Strict-Alternation is turn-based algorithm to solve the mutual exclusion problem.
frontmatter.title: Strict Alternation

frontmatter.preview_text: Binary search is an algorithm to find a given element within a sorted array.
frontmatter.title: Binary Search

frontmatter.preview_text: Fisher's protocol is an algorithm to solve the mutual exclusion problem.
frontmatter.title: Fisher's Algorithm

frontmatter.preview_text: Mergesort is a recursive sorting algorithm based on divide and conquer principle.
frontmatter.title: Mergesort

frontmatter.preview_text: Kadane's algorithm solves the maximum-subarray-problem, where the task is finding the contiguous subarray with maximal sum.
frontmatter.title: Kadane's Algorithm

frontmatter.preview_text: Alpha-Beta search is an advanced version of the Minimax algorithm, where the best possible score in a game after players get to move a certain number of times is determined.
frontmatter.title: Alpha-Beta

frontmatter.preview_text: The Minimax algorithm determines the best score in a game after players get to move a certain number of times.
frontmatter.title: Minimax
